Headline: Scott Reeves
Article_Body: Scott Reeves is a Director of Coverage for CNN International. He is responsible for news coverage from the Asia-Pacific region, as well as leading the network's global coverage during key parts of the day.     Prior to this role, Reeves was the Executive Producer for CNN World Sport for six years, overseeing all of the network's sports shows from Atlanta and London. This included overseeing the network's programming around major events, including the 2014 and 2018 World Cups and the 2016 Summer and 2018 Winter Olympics. Before that, he was a Supervising Producer in CNN's newsroom based in Atlanta. Before joining CNN in 2007, Reeves was a producer at ITN's Channel 4 News in London for six years.   Reeves is originally from Suffolk in the UK. He studied History and Politics at Exeter University in the UK and the College of William and Mary in Virginia in the United States. He obtained a Masters Degree in International Journalism from City University in London.
